thread.title: Bst of the rest: More fun things to do Oct. 1-7
thread.title_full: Bst of the rest: More fun things to do Oct. 1-7

author: freep.com
title: Bst of the rest: More fun things to do Oct. 1-7
text:
MORE ROYAL OAK
Doggone good time
Dog lovers and their furry friends are invited to Paws in the Park for a two-day festival of entertainment, pet adoptions, food and fun. This annual event has been relocated to Memorial Park in Royal Oak.
Shows will include Disc Dogs of Michigan’s High-Flying Dog Show, Rock ’n’ Roll K9s and Michigan Search and Rescue. Other events will include the best dog costume, pug run, wiener dog race and canine-human look-alike contests.
Vendors will be onsite with information on pet nutrition, obedience training, pet care, grooming and the latest pet accessories.
Several local organizations will offer adoptable pets looking for homes.
10 a.m.-5 p.m. Saturdayand Sunday. Memorial Park (corner of 13 Mile & Woodward) in Royal Oak. pawsintheparkroyaloak.com . $5, children 10 and younger admitted free.
DETROIT
Harvest Festival
You can enjoy autumn festivities and free family fun Saturday in Detroit’s Palmer Park.
Activities will include hayrides, Farmer John and his Barnyard Express show, a petting zoo, corn grilling, apple tastings and pumpkin picking. There will also be arts and crafts, tug-of-war, sack races and other old-fashioned games.
Apple cider and doughnut holes will be available for the first 500 guests.
1-4 p.m. Saturday. Palmer Park, by the Splash Park parking lot, Merrill Plaisance, between McNichols and Seven Mile, Detroit.
— Brendel Hightower, Detroit Free Press
